# eslint/no-proto <Badge type="info" text="Restriction" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">ðŸš§</span> An auto-fix is still under development.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Disallow the use of the `__proto__` property

### Why is this bad?

The `__proto__` property has been deprecated as of ECMAScript 3.1 and
shouldnâ€™t be used in new code. Use `Object.getPrototypeOf` and
`Object.setPrototypeOf` instead.

### Example

```javascript
/*eslint no-proto: "error"*/

var a = obj.__proto__;

var a = obj["__proto__"];

obj.__proto__ = b;

obj["__proto__"] = b;
```

## How to use

To **enable** this rule in the CLI or using the config file, you can use:

::: code-group

```bash [CLI]
oxlint --deny no-proto
```

```json [Config (.oxlintrc.json)]
{
  "rules": {
    "no-proto": "error"
  }
}
```

:::
